Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer:
I often make small mistakes while working,
or I misunderstand what is expected of me.
I tend to rush through work that I don't find interesting.

I have trouble leaving myself enough time to do things,
whether schoolwork or things I want to do.
I often lose things that are important to me.
I have trouble remembering facts in school.
I often forget to do things, even when they are important to me.

Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer: I often have trouble focusing on a single thing for long periods of time.

I often miss what people say to me, even if I am trying
to stay engaged in the conversation.
I prefer to multitask rather than focusing on one thing at a time.
When working in a group, I prefer to let others do the difficult parts.
I often leave things half finished.

When a task requires me to concentrate for a long time,
I put it off until the last minute.

I often get distracted, either by things happening around me,
or by the thoughts in my head.

Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer: I prefer active hobbies such as playing sports over passive ones such as reading.
I often fidget with things, tap my fingers, or shake my legs.
I often feel the urge to stand up and walk around when stressed.
I often feel restless.
Others have told me to stay still, or that they have trouble keeping up with me.
I seem to have an endless source of energy; I don't get tired easily.

Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer: When I am playing a game, I get excited and tend to make a lot of noise.
People have told me I often talk too much.
I often predict what people are going to say.
I hate having to wait in lines.

When others are taking too long to complete a task,
I want to take over and do it myself.
I have a short temper.
I get annoyed when people walk too slowly in front of me.

Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer: I have a hard time talking to others, it feels like there are rules to it that I don't get.

I never know how to interpret or use nonverbal social cues. Things like eye-contact,
gestures and facial expressions seem like a different language to me.
I'm not really good at making friends.

I often struggle with speaking in a way the situation calls for.
I might talk too loud/quiet, too formal/informally, etc.

People often say things that have hidden meanings I don't understand.
I'm not very good at understanding things like metaphors and sarcasm.
I get overly nervous for big social events or presentations.
Spending time socializing with others makes me tired.

Questions.question: Please select any/all of the following statements which form a common theme in your day-to-day life.

options.answer: I often fidget with things, repeat phrases or make the same movement over and over again.

I like to keep things the same, like keeping a consistent routine,
taking the same route to school/work or eating the same food.

There are one or two topics I like to spend a majority
of my time learning or thinking about.

According to others, I often under or overreact to things like bright lights,
loud noises, textures, smells, interesting visuals etc.

I often experience intrusive thoughts.
These scare me and I try my best to get rid of them somehow.

I often do or think a certain thing to reduce stress about something that's been occupying my
mind, even though it's not related, or because I feel like something bad will happen if I don't.

I have a lucky charm, which I like to carry with me to important
or stressful events such as exams.
I often notice minute details that others may overlook.

Questions.question: Your teacher has graded an essay you submitted, but your grade is lower than you expected. It seems you have misunderstood the task. What happened?

options.answer: I forgot the details of the instructions we were given.

I got carried away while writing, and half of my essay ended up being about
a different topic than assigned.

Questions.question:
You're taking an exam for one of your courses.
Which of the following are you more likely to do?

options.answer: I reread every question several times because I often make mistakes while answering.
I try to complete the exam and leave the exam hall as quickly as possible.

Questions.question: Your teacher calls you in to their office. Why are they unhappy with you?

options.answer: I often overlook parts of questions in tests, causing my answers to be incorrect.
I often talk during class when we are expected to be working quietly.

Questions.question:
You are working on a group project, but things are not going well.
What is most likely the issue?

options.answer: I keep forgetting to schedule enough time to work on my part of the project.

My teammates have not texted me about the project yet,
and I'm too scared to be the one to start the conversation.

Questions.question: You missed the bus to class this morning. What caused you to be late?

options.answer: I didn't leave myself enough time to get ready, and I couldn't run to the bus stop on time.

I wasn't sure whether I turned the stove off after making breakfast,
so I had to go back to check.

Questions.question: You are sitting in a lecture and are feeling bored out of your mind. Which of these do you do?

options.answer: I occupy my mind with thoughts of what I might do later today.
I fidget with my things and tap my feet to release energy.

Questions.question: You're talking to an acquaintance, but you've unintentionally committed a social faux pas. What happened?

options.answer: I forgot to listen to a question they asked me.
I started answering their question while they were still talking.

Questions.question: Your friends have invited you to a busy party with many people you don't know, but you are the first one from your circle to show up. What do you do?

options.answer: I go talk to as many new people as I can.
I distract myself until my friends show up.

Questions.question: You meet a friend at a busy cafe, but you struggle to process the words they are saying to you. What has happened?

options.answer: I keep getting distracted by the variety of noises that surround me.
I get distracted by my thoughts; something has been bothering me all day.

Questions.question: You are watching a movie with friends, but they are annoyed at you. Why is this?

options.answer: I keep moving in my seat; I can't seem to find a comfortable position.
I predicted the ending of the movie 5 minutes in.

Questions.question: A fellow student comes up to you during class and tells you they noticed you look uncomfortable. What did they notice about you?

options.answer: I don't sit still, but move around and fidget.
I seem to be avoiding looking at or talking to people.

Questions.question: You are on your way to school, when you get stuck in traffic, meaning you will likely be late to class. What is your reaction?

options.answer: Having to sit in the middle of the traffic jam makes me extremely angry.
I panic about the prospect of being late.

Questions.question: You are trying to socialize in a group context, but you are having trouble. What has happened?

options.answer: I have a tendency to overshare; I'm never sure when to stop talking.

People don't leave room for me to speak,
making it difficult for me to contribute to the discussion.

Questions.question: You are working on a school project with a partner, but you keep feeling the urge to take over and do everything yourself. Why?

options.answer: My partner overthinks every detail and I know I can do the work faster.
I don't agree with the details of how my partner wants to complete the task.

Questions.question: Your friends tell you that sometimes having a conversation with you can feel one-sided. Why could this be?

options.answer: I don't like volunteering pieces of information about myself.
I often say similar things each time we talk.

Text.introduction:
This interactive quiz is designed to distinguish between common differential diagnoses of Autism Spectrum Disorder.


How does it work?

You'll be presented with multiple-choice questions about everyday situations.
Choose the option that feels most like you.

Based on your answer, you'll move on to a "Select All That Apply" question.
Here, select any statements that you feel apply to you.

Once there is enough information, you will receive a potential diagnosis
which you could look into with a professional.
Text.disclaimer:
This quiz is meant to provide a starting point for your mental health journey and is for informational purposes only, it does not give a definitive medical diagnosis.
For professional advice, please consult a qualified healthcare provider.
